page.title: 02Ouse River Walk : Rawcliffe
page.content: On Thursday 4th July 1985 we went for a walk by the river.We set off from Clifton bridge on to the footpath and by the flood barrier which allows the water from the river to flow on to the Ings if there is a danger of flooding. On the other bank there were people paddling in the river as it was a hot day. As we walked we saw several people swimming and some fishing.A few pleasure boats were going up and down the river too.We saw the sugar beet factory and trains on the railway line on the other side of the river and across the meadows to Rawcliffe and Clifton to the east.A farmer was using a hay tedder to turn over the hay which lay on the ground.We walked for about 2km and stopped for lunch by a stone jetty.There was a herd of fresian cows in the field and they came to drink at the river.
